results.title: A Night at the show
results.creator_credit: Essanay Film Manufacturing Company and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: Based on a skit from Chaplin’s vaudeville days with Charlie in a dual role as a gentleman in evening dress and as a hobo. Both wreak havoc at the theatre.

results.title: A Night at the opera
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Irving G. Thalberg and Sam Wood
results.brief_description: This original comedy with sparkling dialogue, delightful music and of course the Marx brothers, is one of the funniest to come from the MGM studio. The action romps along at madcap pace as Groucho, Chico and Harpo go into the grand opera business in Italy, dash across the Atlantic and stage an opera in New York, that has the city on its ear. It is an opera such as has never been seen before. Rated: G

results.title: A Nice sort of accident to have
results.brief_description: A report on progress toward car safety, illustrating the differences in approach found in Britain and the USA. Considers statistics relating to accidents, current driver psychology research, reasons for Britain’s need to follow US regulation to maintain exports, and the “airbag”. Also comments on the fact that New South Wales has declared compulsory seat belt wearing.

results.title: A Nice place to be (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: La Trobe University. Centre for the Study of Educational Communication and Media, Patricia Edgar and Dave McRae
results.brief_description: Looks at the aims and problems of the Sydney Road Community School, an alternative community school in Melbourne, and the nature of the experiment undertaken there. Each child is allowed to choose which subjects he wishes to take and which class he goes into with a particular teacher.

results.title: A New world below
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker, Barry Cowling and Mike Mahoney
results.brief_description: The extension of Canada’s coastal sovereignty to 322 km (200 miles), together with the increase in offshore oil and gas activity, has led to a dramatic increase in the demand for knowledge about the sea. The film highlights the work of the Atlantic Geoscience Centre, Bedford Institute of Oceanography, in Nova Scotia. Stunning visuals include rolling icebergs and undersea volcanoes. Research is shown to depend on both high-technology and patient, minute analysis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker, Barry Cowling and Mike Mahoney

results.title: A New way of looking for tuna
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Southern blue fin tuna schools are attracted to water with a particular surface temperature. Marine scientists use aircraft to map sea surface isotherms and pinpoint these places for the fishermen. The result is increased catches.

results.title: A New look at the sun
results.brief_description: Describes the radioheliograph at the CSIRO Solar Observatory at Culgoora, near Narrabri, N.S.W. This large circular array of 96 antennae provides a unique instrument for observing brief solar surface disturbances.

results.title: A new day in Samoa
results.brief_description: The people of Western Samoa and their progress toward self-government. The pattern of village life, growing cash crops, Apia the capital and chief port, parades, Robert Louis Stevenson’s grave, building new churches, the work of health sisters, education, internal self government, New Zealand administration and economic assistance, the combination of British and Samoan tradition.

results.title: A New art in cooking
results.creator_credit: Jerry Warner and Lawry's Food Inc
results.brief_description: Every woman, no matter why her culinary talents, can produce unique and exciting cooking masterpieces in her own kitchen through the artistry of seasoning blends/ Employing works of master painters to introduce this concept, the film demonstrates the ease with which readily available seasoning ingredients can be used to add zest and variety to every meal. In addition, imaginative table settings provide new ideas.
